title: How does Plato, allegory of the cave, distinguish appearance from reality? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, allegory first. Like an explanation, an allegory relies on our familiarity and comfort to help us understand something previously beyond us. It’s not an entirely bad system but it’s not strong enough for modern science - and it’s predictive value depends upon how it is interpreted , how it is used. It’s the stuff of clever stories. “ The p;oor man really was like a lion … but lacked the teeth. ‘Nough said. So the allegory in the case of the cave. The first side of the allegory involves a bunch of people in a cave watching the shadows from the outside. They watch the shadows all their lives and that forms their conception of reality. The second part the ordinary people live in the real world outside the cave, and they use light {not shadow} to make sense of another reality. Then there is the philosopher who, contemplating the analogy between the cave dwellers and the outsiders, realizes that there is a third element, for the philosopher has to know not by shadows, not by ordinary light, but by reason and a determined search for truth. Shadows, real light, and the world learned by reason. That’s it. Very, very clever. Analogies are a lousy way to find the truth but a wonderful tool for teaching. His analogy still works after more than two thousand years. Even today we instantly grab the idea of an alternate reality and the question becomes which is the one for us. And with which shall we choose to live? The shadows? Or in that common sunlight? Or, even better, in that good light of reason? Great stuff! Now, I’m asked, does Plato help us hold fast to that better light? The record is plain! It survives after more than two thousand years as a key introduction to intelligent life - the intellectual’s discovery of wisdom, it is the moment of baptism … for our minds.

In a virtual reality or in a fake reality in the cave, people is put to chains unable to move. They cant speak and they dont have enough light at least no sun light, that gives shadows on the walls of the cave of their guards and the items they carry. In reality persons are able to be in the sun light, they are able to move, to speak, to observe direct all objects and beings as the light is adequate and helps on that. This is a simplified answer on that subject that needs hundreds of books to explain as the Cave allegory is complicated and applies to many many situations.

Just one question… Do you go through your life only believing that your life is that of your shadow? I didn’t think so. Please understand that you are the soul and not this body. Because of this you are “PURE AWARENESS ONLY.” This pure awareness is called the “light of knowing” for a reason. Come out of the cave and into the light.
